block.p: Micki Mai-hsi Chen and Prof. Steven Allan Gross are to be married today at the Sequoia, a restaurant in Washington. Judge Emily Hewitt of the United States Court of Federal Claims in Washington is to officiate.
The couple, both 35, graduated from Harvard University, from which the bride also received a law degree and the bridegroom a Ph.D. in philosophy.

Micki Mai-hsi Chen and Prof. Steven Allan Gross are to be married today at the Sequoia, a restaurant in Washington. Judge Emily Hewitt of the United States Court of Federal Claims in Washington is to officiate.
The couple, both 35, graduated from Harvard University, from which the bride also received a law degree and the bridegroom a Ph.D. in philosophy.

Ms. Chen is keeping her name. She is the general counsel to Verizon's long-distance telephone subsidiary in Arlington, Va. Her parents, Jane Chin-ju Chen and Philip Tsu-chung Chen, live in Montvale, N.J., where the bride's father is a chemical engineering consultant. Her mother is the accountant in the medical practice of the bride's sister, Dr. Lucy Chen, in Morristown, N.J.

Mr. Gross is an assistant professor of philosophy at the University of Pennsylvania and an affiliated faculty member of the University's Institute for Research in Cognitive Science. His parents, Linda and Jerome Gross, live in Baltimore, where his father is a senior partner in Gross, Mendelsohn & Associates, a management consulting and financial planning firm. The bridegroom's mother is a partner in Caplan/Gross Associates, an executive recruiting company in Towson, Md.
